definition: to escape from the abyss of suffering/to shed off a wretched plight
to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from
mythical beast (archaic)
to leave/to part from/to be away from/(in giving distances) from/without (sth)/independent of/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing fire/☲
surname Li
bitter/hardship/pain/to suffer/to bring suffering to/painstakingly
ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous
surname Hai

sentences.english: How can I use this to get Nate off the hook?
sentences.chinese: 我怎样才能利用这个，让内特脱离苦海呢？

sentences.english: The emergence of another national movement is still Somalia's best hope of escaping misery.
sentences.chinese: 让索马里脱离苦海最大的希望还是再有一次国民运动。

sentences.english: I congratulate him, he finally escaped from suffering sea.
sentences.chinese: 我恭喜他终于脱离苦海了。

definition: lit. sea of bitterness/abyss of worldly suffering (Buddhist term)/depths of misery
lit. to jump out of a fire pit (idiom); to escape from a living hell/to free oneself from a life of torture
to untie/to free/to absolve of/to get free of/to extirpate oneself/(Buddhism) to free oneself of worldly worries
to get back on the right path/to mend one's ways
virtuous achievements come to their successful conclusion (idiom)
to abandon suffering and obtain happiness (Buddhism)
to achieve supreme enlightenment or nirvana (Buddhism)
to mend one's ways (idiom)/to turn over a new leaf
to rescue
lit. to wash one's heart and renew one's face (idiom); to repent sincerely and mend one's mistaken ways/to turn over a new leaf
deep water and scorching fire/abyss of suffering (idiom)
to end one's suffering by dying quickly and being reincarnated/(fig.) to get it over with
lit. to ascend to heaven/to die
to suffer hardship
(Buddhism) to deliver all living creatures from suffering (idiom)
lit. to rein in the horse at the edge of the precipice (idiom)/fig. to act in the nick of time
